\pgfdeclareshape{circulator}
{

    \inheritanchor[from=circle]{south}
    \inheritanchor[from=circle]{south west}
    \inheritanchor[from=circle]{south east}
    \inheritbackgroundpath[from=circle]
    \count@=0
    \let\tikz@circ@moveto=\pgfutil@empty
    \let\tikz@circ@moveto@first=\pgfutil@empty
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@first=\pgfutil@empty
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@second=\pgfutil@empty
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@last=\pgfutil@empty
    \let\tikz@circ@close=\pgfutil@empty

        angle step/.initial={10},name/.initial={},name in/.code={%

            \expandafter\def\expandafter\tikz@circ@curveto@first\expandafter{\tikz@circ@curveto@first#1}%
            \expandafter\def\expandafter\tikz@circ@curveto@second\expandafter{\tikz@circ@curveto@second#1}%
            \expandafter\def\expandafter\tikz@circ@curveto@last\expandafter{\tikz@circ@curveto@last#1}%
            \expandafter\def\expandafter\tikz@circ@moveto@last\expandafter{\tikz@circ@moveto@last#1}%
            \pgfkeys{/tikz/circ/.cd,#1}%
        }
    }
    \def\tikz@circ@moveto#1{%
    \def\tikz@circ@moveto@first{#1}%
    \let\tikz@circ@moveto@second=\pgfutil@empty%
    \expandafter\def\expandafter\tikz@circ@moveto@first\expandafter{\tikz@circ@moveto@first#1}}%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto#1#2#3{%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@first{#1}%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@second{#2}%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@last{#3}%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@first=\pgfutil@empty%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@second=\pgfutil@empty%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@last=\pgfutil@empty%
    \pgfkeys{/tikz/circ/.cd,#1}%
    \advance \count@   by 1 \relax
    \pgf@xa=\pgf@x \pgf@ya=\pgf@y
    \pgf@x=0.75\pgf@xa
    \advance \pgf@x by 1.5\relax
    \edef\pgf@temp{\noexpand\pgfqpoint{\the\pgf@xa}{\the\pgf@ya}}
    \expandafter\let\expandafter\pgf@temp\expandafter\fi
    \advance \pgf@xa by \pgf@x
    \advance \pgf@ya by \pgf@y
    \pgf@x=.125\pgf@xa
    \pgf@y=.125\pgf@ya
    \pgf@xb=\pgf@x
    \pgf@yb=\pgf@y
    \pgf@x=.0625\pgf@xa
    \pgf@y=.125\pgf@yb
    \advance\pgf@xb by.0625\pgf@xa
    \advance\pgf@yb by.125\pgf@ya
    \pgfkeys{/tikz/circ/.cd,#1}%
    }
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto#1#2#3{%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@first{#1}%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@second{#2}%
    \def\tikz@circ@curveto@last{#3}%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@first=\pgfutil@empty%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@second=\pgfutil@empty%
    \let\tikz@circ@curveto@last=\pgfutil@empty%
    \pgftransformshift{%
    \pgfpointadd{\pgfqpoint{\the\pgf@x}{\the\pgf@y}}%
    {\pgfpoint{\pgf@xb}{\pgf@yb}}%
    \pgf@xa=\pgf@x
    \pgf@ya=\pgf@y
    \advance \pgf@xa   by -\pgf@xb
    \advance \pgf@ya   by -\pgf@yb
    \pgf@xb=-.75\pgf@xa

    \pgf@yb=-.75\pgf@ya

    \pgf@yb=.125\pgf@ya
    \advance \pgf@y by.5\relax
    \pgf@xb=.0625\pgf@xb
    \advance \pgf@xb by.0625\pgf@xa
    \pgf@yb=.0625\pgf@yb
    \advance\pgf@yb by.0625\pgf@ya
    \pgf@y=.0625\pgf@yb
    \advance\pgf@yb by.0625\pgf@xa
    \advance\pgf@xb by.0625\pgf@xa
    \advance\pgf@yb by.0625\pgf@xa
    }
    \def\tikz@circ@moveto@last#1{%
    \def\tikz@circ@moveto@first{#1}%
    \pgftransformshift{%
    \pgfpointadd{\pgfpoint{\the\pgf@x}{\the\pgf@y}}%

\documentclass[border=1cm]{standalone}
\usepackage{tikz}

\begin{document}
\pagestyle{empty}

\begin{comment}
:Title: Composition of bent hyperbolic series
:Slug: bent-series
:Tags: Foreach

We define the `bent hyperbolic series` as the infinite sum
\[ \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{V_{3}\wedge
  J_{n}\wedge H_{n} \wedge B_{n}}{\left(\frac{M_{n}}{(n!)} \frac{1}{n!} \right)^{2}}
\]

The series converges if the `B-n` are convergent. We prove here
that the convergence of the hyperbolic series is equivalent to the
convergence of the `B-series`. We also prove that the series
converges if the $B-n$ are convergent and the $M_3^n$ are
convergent. In both cases, we use the `contraction` lemma to
prove the convergence.

Note that the $B_0$ term is already convergent, since it is a
boloometric series. Also, we show how to apply the
`contraction` lemma to each term of the series.
\end{comment}

\begin{tikzpicture}
    \definecolor{color0}{rgb}{0.12156862745098,0.466666666666667,0.705882352941177}
    \definecolor{color1}{rgb}{1,0.498039215686275,0.0549019607843137}
    \definecolor{color2}{rgb}{0.172549019607843,0.627450980392157,0.172549019607843}
    \definecolor{color3}{rgb}{0.83921568627451,0.152941176470588,0.156862745098039}
    \definecolor{color4}{rgb}{0.580392156862745,0.403921568627451,0.741176470588235}
    \definecolor{color5}{rgb}{0.549019607843137,0.337254901960784,0.294117647058824}
    \definecolor{color6}{rgb}{0.890196078431372,0.466666666666667,0.76078431372549}
    
    \begin{axis}[
        hide axis,
        % xtick=\empty,
        % ytick=\empty,
        % legend style={draw=none},
        % legend pos=south east,
        %line width=0.9pt,
        height=0.7cm,
        xmin=0,
        ymin=0,
        % domain=0:10,
        % width=9cm,
        % with background rectangle,
        ylabel=$\overline{H}(t)$,
        xlabel=$t$,
        % x label style={at={(axis description cs:0.5,-0.1)},anchor=north},
        x label style={at={(axis description cs:-0.0625,0.5)},anchor=south},
        % y label style={at={(axis description cs:0.1,.5)},anchor=north},
        axis background/.style={fill=white},
        xmajorgrids,
        ymajorgrids,
        legend style={at={(0.06,0.9)},anchor=east}
    ]
    \addplot[
        color=color0,
        % line width=0.3pt,
        % mark=none,
        smooth,
        samples=100,
        domain=0:2.5]
        {exp(-1*0.5*x)*( cos(deg(x*2*pi*0.1)) + 2*exp(-1*0.5*x) * sin(deg(x*2*pi*0.1)) + 2*exp(-1*0.5*x) * cos(deg(x*2*pi*0.1))) };
    \addlegendentry{$H_0(t)$}
    \addplot[
        color=color1,
        % line width=0.3pt,
        % mark=none,
        smooth,
        samples=100,
        domain=0:2.5]
        {exp(-1*0.5*x)*( cos(deg(x*2*pi*0.1)) + exp(-1*0.5*x) * sin(deg(x*2*pi*0.1)) + exp(-1*0.5*x) * cos(deg(x*2*pi*0.1))) };
    \addlegendentry{$H_1(t)$}
    
    \addplot[
        color=color2,
        line width=0.3pt,
        mark=none,
        smooth,
        domain=0:2.5]
        coordinates {(0.25,0)(0.25,1.15)};
        %        
    \addplot[
        color=color3,
        line width=0.3pt,
        mark=none,
        smooth,
        domain=0:2.5]
        coordinates {(0.75,0)(0.75,1.15)};
        %        
    \addplot[
        color=color4,
        line width=0.3pt,
        mark=none,
        smooth,
        domain=0:2.5]
        coordinates {(1.25,0)(1.25,1.15)};
        %        
    \addplot[
        color=white,
        line width=0.5pt,
        mark=none,
        smooth,
        domain=0:2.5]
        coordinates {(1.75,0)(1.75,1.15)};
        %        
    \addplot[
        color=gray,
        line width=0.5pt,
        mark=none,
        smooth,
        domain=0:2.5]
        coordinates {(2.25,0)(2.25,1.15)};
    \end{axis}
    
    \end{tikzpicture}

\documentclass[tikz,border=3mm]{standalone}
\usetikzlibrary{calc,matrix,decorations.pathreplacing,positioning,fit}
\begin{document}
    \begin{tikzpicture}[node distance=0mm, inner ysep=1mm,
        % Styles
        cell/.style={ % Style for the nodes inside the matrix
            inner sep=0mm, minimum size=1.5mm,
            draw, thick},
        I/.style={ % Style for the big boxes at the matrix corners
            cell, minimum width=12mm, draw=none, thick},
        O/.style={ % Style for the labels below the matrix
            cell, minimum width=10mm, draw=none, thick},
        P/.style={ % Style for the big boxes at the matrix corners
            cell, minimum width=22mm, thick},
        dots/.style args={between #1 and #2 with #3}{
            decorate,
            decoration={show path construction,
                lineto code={%
                    \foreach \point in {#1}{%
                        \draw[dashed, gray] (\point) -- (\point-|#2);
                    }
                }
            }
        },
        sum/.style={ % Style for the red dots in the center
            dots={between {0,4} and {1,8} with \textbullet},
            inner sep=0mm, fill=red!30, circle, draw=red!50!black!50},
        dot/.style={ % Style for the red dot at the center
            dots={between #1 and {1,8} with \textbullet},
